question: If you could choose between living in a country with four distinct seasons or one with year-round warm weather, which would you choose?
title: Language & Vocabulary
content:
• Instead of "good", try: beneficial, advantageous, favorable.
  • Instead of "enjoy", try: appreciate, relish, take pleasure in.
  • Instead of "weather", try: climate, atmospheric conditions, meteorological variations.
  • You said: "Having a good weather is nice" → You could say: "Experiencing favorable weather conditions is enjoyable."
  • You said: "I think you can really enjoy whether or state" → You could say: "I believe that appreciating various weather conditions enhances one's quality of life."
  • You said: "It's too cold for me" → You could say: "The cold temperatures can be quite challenging for me."

question: When learning about different cultures, do you prefer to read books and watch documentaries, or do you prefer to travel and experience cultures directly ? Support your answer with specific reasons.
title: Language & Vocabulary
content:
• Repetitive or basic phrases include: "very important," "discover other cultures," and "through books."
    • Instead of "important," try: significant, crucial, essential.
    • Instead of "discover," try: explore, uncover, learn about.
    • Instead of "through," try: via, by means of, utilizing.
  • You said: "So read books is a testimony that someone who has traveled can can make for other people."
    You could say: "Reading books provides insights and perspectives from those who have traveled, enriching our understanding of various cultures."
  • You said: "it can be through books, through movies, through documentaries."
    You could say: "Cultural knowledge can be gained through literature, films, and documentaries."
